members.member:
Return the time elapsed in hours between the specified sun angle from 90o in am and pm. +ve above the horizon, -ve below the horizon.
\param DayOfYear The day of year \param SunAngle \parblock Angle to measure time between such as twilight (deg). angular distance between 90 deg and end of twilight - altitude of sun. +ve up, -ve down. Civil twilight ends after sunset or begins before sunrise when the solar depression angle is 6deg;. e.g SunAngle = -6deg; Nautical twilight : 12deg; Astronomical twilight : 18deg; \endparblock \param Latitude Latitude to calculate the day length (deg;) \return Day length in hours between the specified sun angle from 90deg; in am and pm.

member.name: M:APSIM.Shared.Utilities.MathUtilities.Sign(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Transfer of sign - from FORTRAN. The result is of the same type and kind as a. Its value is the abs(a) of a, if b is greater than or equal positive zero; and -abs(a), if b is less than or equal to negative zero. Example a = sign (30,-2) ! a is assigned the value -30

members.member: The following set of routines is taken from the old CPI StdStrng.pas unit. Token-handling routines for use in parsing. A token is either: * a string made up of alphanumeric characters and/or the underscore * any string enclosed in double quotes (the quotes are stripped) * a punctuation mark (other than double quotes)

member.name: M:APSIM.Shared.Utilities.StringUtilities.TextToken(System.String@,System.String@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: TextToken strips the first token from a string.
member.param: String from which a token is to be taken. It is returned as the remaining part of the input value (including any leading whitespace).
Returned as the token which has been taken from InSt. If InSt is null or entirely whitespace, then Token will be the null string.
If true, case is unchanged, otherwise the "returned" token is converted to uppercase.

member.name: M:APSIM.Shared.Utilities.StringUtilities.MatchToken(System.String@,System.String)
member.summary: Function which returns TRUE i.f.f. the first token in a string matches an input token. The match is case-insensitive.
member.param: String in which to look for Match. If Match is found, then inSt will contain the remainder of the string (including any leading whitespace) on return. If not, inSt is returned unchanged.
Token to be sought. If Match is not a token, its first token is used instead.
member.returns: TRUE i.f.f. the first token in a string match

member.name: M:APSIM.Shared.Utilities.StringUtilities.TokenInt(System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Take an integer from the front of a string.
member.param: String from which to take an integer. If it is found, then inSt will contain the remainder of the string (including any leading whitespace). If not, InSt is returned unchanged.
Returns the integer value. If no integer is found in the string, N is undefined.
member.returns: Returns TRUE i.f.f. an integer was found.

member.name: M:APSIM.Shared.Utilities.StringUtilities.TokenFloat(System.String@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Take a floating-point value from the front of a string. Rules are analogous to Token_Int. Exponential notation is dealt with.
member.param: String from which to take a value. If it is found, then inSt will contain the remainder of the string (including any leading whitespace). If not, InSt is returned unchanged.
Returns the value. If no value is found in the string, x is undefined.
member.returns: Returns TRUE i.f.f. a value was found.

member.name: M:APSIM.Shared.Utilities.StringUtilities.TokenDouble(System.String@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Take a double value from the front of a string. Rules are analogous to Token_Int. Exponential notation is dealt with.
member.param: String from which to take a value. If it is found, then inSt will contain the remainder of the string (including any leading whitespace). If not, InSt is returned unchanged.
Returns the value. If no value is found in the string, x is undefined.
member.returns: Returns TRUE i.f.f. a value was found.

member.summary: Removes string from end of a given string
